title: Plastic Pollution Is Killing Coral Reefs, 4-Year Study Finds
body: Science 8 Million Tons Of Plastic Clutter Our Seas "The likelihood of disease increases from 4 percent to 89 percent when corals are in contact with plastic," researchers report in the journal...
readable_content:
- User (2023-12-08): Hi, I read a part of a text about a study on the impact of plastic pollution on coral reefs. Can you give me some information about plastic pollution and its effects on coral reefs based on the text?
- User (2023-12-08): Thanks!
summary:
The impact of plastic pollution on coral reefs can be devastating. Plastics can entangle corals, leading to tissue damage and death. Additionally, they can also smother corals and block sunlight, hindering their photosynthetic processes. Chemical pollutants from plastics can also harm coral health and disrupt their reproduction. Ultimately, plastic pollution poses a significant threat to the survival of coral reefs. 

Sentiment: -0.9
